a:5:{s:1:"d";a:4:{i:0;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7259";s:12:"article_type";s:12:"publications";s:3:"uri";s:55:"gender-security-and-safety-in-the-asean-digital-economy";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"3";s:5:"title";s:55:"Gender Security and Safety in the ASEAN Digital Economy";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-12-13";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"12";s:7:"content";s:1409:"<p style="text-align: justify;">Gender-based cyber violence inhibits progress towards gender digital equality by discouraging women from participating in the digital economy. From the magnitude of the problem to its economic and social impacts, much remains to be understood about how women experience safety and security in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) digital economy. Drawing on academic and grey literature, this paper reflects on the implications of gender-based cyber violence for digital equality and economic development. Overall, data are lacking on the prevalence, economic costs, and social impacts of gender-based cyber violence within ASEAN. Policy tends to focus more on measuring domestic and intimate partner violence, likely due to its designation as the main indicator for Sustainable Development Goal 5. Although a variety of national, regional, and global frameworks exist to address different dimensions of violence against women, cybersecurity, and workplace harassment, more work is needed to identify the scale and scope of gender-based cyber violence in the region, in order to target policy appropriately.</p><p class="pdf"><a title="ERIA-DP-2022-36" href="/uploads/media/discussion-papers/FY22/Gender-Security-and-Safety-in-the-ASEAN-Digital-Economy.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Gender Security and Safety in the ASEAN Digital Economy</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:73:"/uploads/publications/20221213/eria-dp-2022-36-no-465---website-cover.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:80:"Digital Economy,women in tech,Gender Equality,Cyber Violence,Cybersecurity,ASEAN";s:6:"editor";s:9:"Araba Sey";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:15:"ERIA-DP-2022-36";s:6:"period";s:4:"2022";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:5:"asean";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-12-13";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:2907:"Gender Security and Safety in the ASEAN Digital Economy Gender Security and Safety in the ASEAN Digital Economy Gender-based cyber violence inhibits progress towards gender digital equality by discouraging women from participating in the digital economy. From the magnitude of the problem to its economic and social impacts, much remains to be understood about how women experience safety and security in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) digital economy. Drawing on academic and grey literature, this paper reflects on the implications of gender-based cyber violence for digital equality and economic development. Overall, data are lacking on the prevalence, economic costs, and social impacts of gender-based cyber violence within ASEAN. Policy tends to focus more on measuring domestic and intimate partner violence, likely due to its designation as the main indicator for Sustainable Development Goal 5. Although a variety of national, regional, and global frameworks exist to address different dimensions of violence against women, cybersecurity, and workplace harassment, more work is needed to identify the scale and scope of gender-based cyber violence in the region, in order to target policy appropriately.
Gender Security and Safety in the ASEAN Digital Economy Digital Economy,women in tech,Gender Equality,Cyber Violence,Cybersecurity,ASEAN Araba Sey  ERIA-DP-2022-36 2022  asean    2022-12-13  2022-12-13 13 December 2022 2202 rebmeceD 31 31-21-2202  31-21-2202    naesa  2202 63-2202-PD-AIRE  yeS abarA NAESA,ytirucesrebyC,ecneloiV rebyC,ytilauqE redneG,hcet ni nemow,ymonocE latigiD ymonocE latigiD NAESA eht ni ytefaS dna ytiruceS redneG
.yletairporppa ycilop tegrat ot redro ni ,noiger eht ni ecneloiv rebyc desab-redneg fo epocs dna elacs eht yfitnedi ot dedeen si krow erom ,tnemssarah ecalpkrow dna ,ytirucesrebyc ,nemow tsniaga ecneloiv fo snoisnemid tnereffid sserdda ot tsixe skrowemarf labolg dna ,lanoiger ,lanoitan fo yteirav a hguohtlA .5 laoG tnempoleveD elbaniatsuS rof rotacidni niam eht sa noitangised sti ot eud ylekil ,ecneloiv rentrap etamitni dna citsemod gnirusaem no erom sucof ot sdnet yciloP .NAESA nihtiw ecneloiv rebyc desab-redneg fo stcapmi laicos dna ,stsoc cimonoce ,ecnelaverp eht no gnikcal era atad ,llarevO .tnempoleved cimonoce dna ytilauqe latigid rof ecneloiv rebyc desab-redneg fo snoitacilpmi eht no stcelfer repap siht ,erutaretil yerg dna cimedaca no gniwarD .ymonoce latigid )NAESA( snoitaN naisA tsaehtuoS fo noitaicossA eht ni ytiruces dna ytefas ecneirepxe nemow woh tuoba dootsrednu eb ot sniamer hcum ,stcapmi laicos dna cimonoce sti ot melborp eht fo edutingam eht morF .ymonoce latigid eht ni gnitapicitrap morf nemow gnigaruocsid yb ytilauqe latigid redneg sdrawot ssergorp stibihni ecneloiv rebyc desab-redneG ymonocE latigiD NAESA eht ni ytefaS dna ytiruceS redneG ymonocE latigiD NAESA eht ni ytefaS dna ytiruceS redneG";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-12-13 13:23:46";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-12-13 13:32:34";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"20";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:1;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7258";s:12:"article_type";s:12:"publications";s:3:"uri";s:82:"women-and-leadership-in-the-asean-digital-economy-mapping-the-rhetorical-landscape";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"3";s:5:"title";s:83:"Women and Leadership in the ASEAN Digital Economy: Mapping the Rhetorical Landscape";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-12-13";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"12";s:7:"content";s:1371:"<p style="text-align: justify;">This paper assesses the nature of policy, media, and research representations of women&rsquo;s inequality in digital leadership, reflecting on how clearly they define the issues, causes, solutions, and resource needs. Overall, women&rsquo;s status in digital leadership receives patchy coverage in the media and insufficient depth of examination in academic and policy research. Existing rhetoric recognises women&rsquo;s inequality as a serious problem in the ASEAN digital economy. However, the dimensions, causes, and solutions especially in terms of digital leadership are rarely clearly defined. There is a dominance of economic narratives to support the need for more women in digital leadership, which demonstrates a higher interest in women as an engine of economic growth than in equal representation as a matter of principle. A heavy dependence on global, European, or North American data highlights the need to improve the collection of gender-disaggregated data within the ASEAN economy.</p><p class="pdf" style="text-align: justify;"><a title="ERIA-DP-2022-35" href="/uploads/media/discussion-papers/FY22/Women-and-Leadership-in-the-ASEAN-Digital-Economy-Mapping-the-Rhetorical-Landscape.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Women and Leadership in the ASEAN Digital Economy: Mapping the Rhetorical Landscape</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:71:"/uploads/publications/20221213/women-and-leadership---website-cover.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:35:"women in tech,Digital Economy,ASEAN";s:6:"editor";s:23:"Araba SEY,Sara KINGSLEY";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:15:"ERIA-DP-2022-35";s:6:"period";s:4:"2022";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:5:"asean";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-12-13";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:2769:"Women and Leadership in the ASEAN Digital Economy: Mapping the Rhetorical Landscape Women and Leadership in the ASEAN Digital Economy: Mapping the Rhetorical Landscape This paper assesses the nature of policy, media, and research representations of women&rsquo;s inequality in digital leadership, reflecting on how clearly they define the issues, causes, solutions, and resource needs. Overall, women&rsquo;s status in digital leadership receives patchy coverage in the media and insufficient depth of examination in academic and policy research. Existing rhetoric recognises women&rsquo;s inequality as a serious problem in the ASEAN digital economy. However, the dimensions, causes, and solutions especially in terms of digital leadership are rarely clearly defined. There is a dominance of economic narratives to support the need for more women in digital leadership, which demonstrates a higher interest in women as an engine of economic growth than in equal representation as a matter of principle. A heavy dependence on global, European, or North American data highlights the need to improve the collection of gender-disaggregated data within the ASEAN economy.
Women and Leadership in the ASEAN Digital Economy: Mapping the Rhetorical Landscape women in tech,Digital Economy,ASEAN Araba SEY,Sara KINGSLEY  ERIA-DP-2022-35 2022  asean    2022-12-13  2022-12-13 13 December 2022 2202 rebmeceD 31 31-21-2202  31-21-2202    naesa  2202 53-2202-PD-AIRE  YELSGNIK araS,YES abarA NAESA,ymonocE latigiD,hcet ni nemow epacsdnaL lacirotehR eht gnippaM :ymonocE latigiD NAESA eht ni pihsredaeL dna nemoW
.ymonoce NAESA eht nihtiw atad detagerggasid-redneg fo noitcelloc eht evorpmi ot deen eht sthgilhgih atad naciremA htroN ro ,naeporuE ,labolg no ecnedneped yvaeh A .elpicnirp fo rettam a sa noitatneserper lauqe ni naht htworg cimonoce fo enigne na sa nemow ni tseretni rehgih a setartsnomed hcihw ,pihsredael latigid ni nemow erom rof deen eht troppus ot sevitarran cimonoce fo ecnanimod a si erehT .denifed ylraelc ylerar era pihsredael latigid fo smret ni yllaicepse snoitulos dna ,sesuac ,snoisnemid eht ,revewoH .ymonoce latigid NAESA eht ni melborp suoires a sa ytilauqeni s;ouqsr&nemow sesingocer cirotehr gnitsixE .hcraeser ycilop dna cimedaca ni noitanimaxe fo htped tneiciffusni dna aidem eht ni egarevoc yhctap seviecer pihsredael latigid ni sutats s;ouqsr&nemow ,llarevO .sdeen ecruoser dna ,snoitulos ,sesuac ,seussi eht enifed yeht ylraelc woh no gnitcelfer ,pihsredael latigid ni ytilauqeni s;ouqsr&nemow fo snoitatneserper hcraeser dna ,aidem ,ycilop fo erutan eht sessessa repap sihT epacsdnaL lacirotehR eht gnippaM :ymonocE latigiD NAESA eht ni pihsredaeL dna nemoW epacsdnaL lacirotehR eht gnippaM :ymonocE latigiD NAESA eht ni pihsredaeL dna nemoW";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-12-13 12:41:53";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-12-13 13:28:14";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"20";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:2;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7255";s:12:"article_type";s:12:"publications";s:3:"uri";s:97:"special-report-of-covid-19-impacts-on-energy-demand-and-energy-saving-potential-in-east-asia-2021";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"3";s:5:"title";s:98:"Special Report of COVID-19 Impacts on Energy Demand and Energy-Saving Potential in East Asia, 2021";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-12-09";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"12";s:7:"content";s:6023:"<p style="text-align: justify;">The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) and East Asia face tremendous challenges in navigating the future energy landscape and in determining how the energy transition will embrace new architectures, including sound policy and technologies, to ensure access to energy that is affordable, secure, and sustainable. The East Asia Summit (EAS) economies have been hit hard by the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, but energy demand growth is expected to bounce back strongly as the economies recover after 2022. All decisions and energy policy measures will need to be weighed against potentially higher energy costs and security risks in the post&ndash;COVID-19 era.</p><h2>Full Report</h2><p class="pdf" style="text-align: justify;"><a title="Full report" href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2022-17/Special-Report-of-COVID-19-Impacts-on-Energy-Demand-and-Energy-Saving-Potential-in-East-Asia-2021..pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Special Report of COVID-19 Impacts on Energy Demand and Energy-Saving Potential in East Asia, 2021</a></p><h2>Contents</h2><p class="pdf"><a Report</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:87:"/uploads/publications/20221209/special-report-od-covid-19-impacts---website-cover-1.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:48:"Energy,COVID-19,East Asia Summit,East Asia,ASEAN";s:6:"editor";s:26:"Shigeru Kimura,Han Phoumin";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:10:"2022-11-17";s:6:"period";s:4:"2022";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:19:"ASEAN and East Asia";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-12-09";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:4123:"Special Report of COVID-19 Impacts on Energy Demand and Energy-Saving Potential in East Asia, 2021 Special Report of COVID-19 Impacts on Energy Demand and Energy-Saving Potential in East Asia, 2021 The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) and East Asia face tremendous challenges in navigating the future energy landscape and in determining how the energy transition will embrace new architectures, including sound policy and technologies, to ensure access to energy that is affordable, secure, and sustainable. The East Asia Summit (EAS) economies have been hit hard by the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, but energy demand growth is expected to bounce back strongly as the economies recover after 2022. All decisions and energy policy measures will need to be weighed against potentially higher energy costs and security risks in the post&ndash;COVID-19 era.
Full Report
Special Report of COVID-19 Impacts on Energy Demand and Energy-Saving Potential in East Asia, 2021

Acknowledgements

Chapter 18&nbsp;United States Country Report Energy,COVID-19,East Asia Summit,East Asia,ASEAN Shigeru Kimura,Han Phoumin  2022-11-17 2022  ASEAN and East Asia    2022-12-09  2022-12-09 9 December 2022 2202 rebmeceD 9 90-21-2202  90-21-2202    aisA tsaE dna NAESA  2202 71-11-2202  nimuohP naH,arumiK uregihS NAESA,aisA tsaE,timmuS aisA tsaE,91-DIVOC,ygrenE tropeR yrtnuoC setatS detinU;psbn&81 retpahC
tropeR yrtnuoC maN teiV;psbn&71 retpahC
tropeR yrtnuoC dnaliahT;psbn&61 retpahC
tropeR yrtnuoC eropagniS;psbn&51 retpahC
tropeR yrtnuoC senippilihP;psbn&41 retpahC
;psbn&tropeR yrtnuoC dnalaeZ weN;psbn&31 retpahC
tropeR yrtnuoC ramnayM;psbn&21 retpahC
tropeR yrtnuoC aisyalaM;psbn&11 retpahC
tropeR yrtnuoC cilbupeR citarcomeD s'elpoeP oaL;psbn&01 retpahC
tropeR yrtnuoC aeroK fo cilbupeR;psbn&9 retpahC
tropeR yrtnuoC napaJ;psbn&8 retpahC
tropeR yrtnuoC aisenodnI;psbn&7 retpahC

seirtnuoC cificaP-aisA eht ni dnameD ygrenE no 91-DIVOC fo stcapmI 2 retpahC
NAESA ni dnameD ygrenE no 91-DIVOC fo tcapmI 1 retpahC

selbaT dna erugiF;psbn&fo tsiL

1202 ,aisA tsaE ni laitnetoP gnivaS-ygrenE dna dnameD ygrenE no stcapmI 91-DIVOC fo tropeR laicepS
tropeR lluF
.are 91-DIVOC;hsadn&tsop eht ni sksir ytiruces dna stsoc ygrene rehgih yllaitnetop tsniaga dehgiew eb ot deen lliw serusaem ycilop ygrene dna snoisiced llA .2202 retfa revocer seimonoce eht sa ylgnorts kcab ecnuob ot detcepxe si htworg dnamed ygrene tub ,cimednap )91-DIVOC( surivanoroc eht yb drah tih neeb evah seimonoce )SAE( timmuS aisA tsaE ehT .elbaniatsus dna ,eruces ,elbadroffa si taht ygrene ot ssecca erusne ot ,seigolonhcet dna ycilop dnuos gnidulcni ,serutcetihcra wen ecarbme lliw noitisnart ygrene eht woh gninimreted ni dna epacsdnal ygrene erutuf eht gnitagivan ni segnellahc suodnemert ecaf aisA tsaE dna )NAESA( snoitaN naisA tsaehtuoS fo noitaicossA ehT 1202 ,aisA tsaE ni laitnetoP gnivaS-ygrenE dna dnameD ygrenE no stcapmI 91-DIVOC fo tropeR laicepS 1202 ,aisA tsaE ni laitnetoP gnivaS-ygrenE dna dnameD ygrenE no stcapmI 91-DIVOC fo tropeR laicepS";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-12-09 14:11:54";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-12-16 12:52:05";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"20";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:3;O:8:"stdClass":46:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7248";s:12:"article_type";s:12:"publications";s:3:"uri";s:78:"new-dynamism-in-asean-and-east-asia-the-role-of-the-rcep-as-a-living-agreement";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"3";s:5:"title";s:94:"New Dynamism in ASEAN and East Asia: The Role of the RCEP as a â€˜Livingâ€™ Agreement";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-12-06";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"12";s:7:"content";s:1000:"<p style="text-align: justify;">This policy brief highlights the importance of maintaining open regionalism and economic and regional integration for sustainable and inclusive regional and global growth in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) and East Asia. With rising global uncertainties and global value chain (GVC) disruptions, the region requires a new economic and social agenda beyond trading arrangements, and the alignment of global, regional, and domestic policies and structural issues. The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) is expected to provide a new institutional framework under the built-in institutional feature (Chapter 18) of the agreement.</p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/policy-brief/FY2022/New-Dynamism-in-ASEAN-and-East-Asia-The-Role-of-the-RCEP-as-a-%E2%80%98Living%E2%80%99-Agreement.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">New Dynamism in ASEAN and East Asia: The Role of the RCEP as a &lsquo;Living&rsquo; Agreement</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:85:"/uploads/publications/20220912/new-dynamism-in-asean-and-east-asia--website-cover.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:46:"RCEP,global value chains,ASEAN,East Asia,Trade";s:6:"editor";s:75:"Shandre Mugan Thangavelu,Fukunari Kimura,Shujiro Urata,Dionisius A. Narjoko";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:15:"ERIA-PB-2022-03";s:6:"period";s:4:"2022";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:15:"asean,East Asia";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-12-06";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:2299:"New Dynamism in ASEAN and East Asia: The Role of the RCEP as a â€˜Livingâ€™ Agreement New Dynamism in ASEAN and East Asia: The Role of the RCEP as a â€˜Livingâ€™ Agreement This policy brief highlights the importance of maintaining open regionalism and economic and regional integration for sustainable and inclusive regional and global growth in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) and East Asia. With rising global uncertainties and global value chain (GVC) disruptions, the region requires a new economic and social agenda beyond trading arrangements, and the alignment of global, regional, and domestic policies and structural issues. The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) is expected to provide a new institutional framework under the built-in institutional feature (Chapter 18) of the agreement.
New Dynamism in ASEAN and East Asia: The Role of the RCEP as a &lsquo;Living&rsquo; Agreement RCEP,global value chains,ASEAN,East Asia,Trade Shandre Mugan Thangavelu,Fukunari Kimura,Shujiro Urata,Dionisius A. Narjoko  ERIA-PB-2022-03 2022  asean,East Asia    2022-12-06  2022-12-06 6 December 2022 2202 rebmeceD 6 60-21-2202  60-21-2202    aisA tsaE,naesa  2202 30-2202-BP-AIRE  okojraN .A suisinoiD,atarU orijuhS,arumiK iranukuF,ulevagnahT naguM erdnahS edarT,aisA tsaE,NAESA,sniahc eulav labolg,PECR tnemeergA ;ouqsr&gniviL;ouqsl& a sa PECR eht fo eloR ehT :aisA tsaE dna NAESA ni msimanyD weN
.tnemeerga eht fo )81 retpahC( erutaef lanoitutitsni ni-tliub eht rednu krowemarf lanoitutitsni wen a edivorp ot detcepxe si )PECR( pihsrentraP cimonocE evisneherpmoC lanoigeR ehT .seussi larutcurts dna seicilop citsemod dna ,lanoiger ,labolg fo tnemngila eht dna ,stnemegnarra gnidart dnoyeb adnega laicos dna cimonoce wen a seriuqer noiger eht ,snoitpursid )CVG( niahc eulav labolg dna seitniatrecnu labolg gnisir htiW .aisA tsaE dna )NAESA( snoitaN naisA tsaehtuoS fo noitaicossA eht ni htworg labolg dna lanoiger evisulcni dna elbaniatsus rof noitargetni lanoiger dna cimonoce dna msilanoiger nepo gniniatniam fo ecnatropmi eht sthgilhgih feirb ycilop sihT tnemeergA ™€âgniviL˜€â a sa PECR eht fo eloR ehT :aisA tsaE dna NAESA ni msimanyD weN tnemeergA ™€âgniviL˜€â a sa PECR eht fo eloR ehT :aisA tsaE dna NAESA ni msimanyD weN";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-12-06 14:39:19";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-12-12 12:09:09";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"20";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}}s:1:"g";a:0:{}s:1:"e";O:8:"DateTime":3:{s:4:"date";s:26:"2023-01-18 08:10:10.905400";s:13:"timezone_type";i:3;s:8:"timezone";s:13:"Europe/Berlin";}s:1:"m";N;s:1:"c";N;}
